010package imagingbook.pub.color.image;
011
012import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
013import java.util.Arrays;
014
015import imagingbook.lib.math.Matrix;
016import imagingbook.lib.settings.PrintPrecision;
017
018/*
019 * This class implements a D65-based sRGBcolor space without performing
020 * chromatic adaptation between D50 and D65, as required by Java's profile 
021 * connection space. Everything is D65!
022 */
023
024public class sRgb65ColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
025
026        private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
027        
028        private static double[][] Mrgb =    // (R,G,B) = Mrgb * (X,Y,Z)   // Poynton (ITU 709) 
029                {{3.240479, -1.537150, -0.498535},
030                 {-0.969256, 1.875992, 0.041556},
031                 {0.055648, -0.204043, 1.057311}};
032        
033        private static double[][] Mrgbi =    // (X,Y,Z) = Mrgbi * (R,G,B)   // Poynton (ITU 709) 
034                {{0.412453, 0.357580, 0.180423},
035                 {0.212671, 0.715160, 0.072169},
036                 {0.019334, 0.119193, 0.950227}};
037
038
039        public sRgb65ColorSpace() {
040                super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
041        }
042
043        // XYZ (D65) -> sRGB
044        @Override
045        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] xyz) {
046                final double X = xyz[0];
047                final double Y = xyz[1];
048                final double Z = xyz[2];
049                
050                // XYZ -> RGB (linear components)
051                final double r =  3.240479 * X + -1.537150 * Y + -0.498535 * Z;
052                final double g = -0.969256 * X +  1.875992 * Y +  0.041556 * Z;
053                final double b =  0.055648 * X + -0.204043 * Y +  1.057311 * Z;
054                
055                // RGB -> sRGB (nonlinear components)
056                float rr = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(r);
057                float gg = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(g);
058                float bb = (float) sRgbUtil.gammaFwd(b);                        
059                return new float[] {rr,gg,bb} ;
060        }
061
062        @Override
063        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
064                return srgb;
065        }
066
067        // sRGB -> XYZ (D65)
068        @Override
069        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] srgb) {
070                // get linear rgb components:
071                final double r = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[0]);
072                final double g = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[1]);
073                final double b = sRgbUtil.gammaInv(srgb[2]);
074                
075                // convert to XYZ (Poynton / ITU 709) 
076                final float x = (float) (0.412453 * r + 0.357580 * g + 0.180423 * b);
077                final float y = (float) (0.212671 * r + 0.715160 * g + 0.072169 * b);
078                final float z = (float) (0.019334 * r + 0.119193 * g + 0.950227 * b);
079                return new float[] {x, y, z};
080        }
081
082        @Override
083        public float[] toRGB(float[] srgb) {
084                return srgb;
085        }
086        
087        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------
088        
089        public static void main(String[] args) {
090                PrintPrecision.set(4);
091                ColorSpace cs = new sRgb65ColorSpace();
092                float[] red = {1, 0, 0};
093                float[] grn = {0, 1, 0};
094                float[] blu = {0, 0, 1};
095                
096                float[] rgb1 = blu;
097                
098                System.out.println("rgb2 = " + Matrix.toString(rgb1));
099                float[] xyz = cs.toCIEXYZ(rgb1);
100                System.out.println("xyz = " + Matrix.toString(xyz));
101                float[] rgb2 = cs.fromCIEXYZ(xyz);
102                System.out.println("rgb3 = " + Matrix.toString(rgb2));
103        }
104
105
106}
